snippet: A 1,o00-page government report puts a spotlight on the detention of thousands of women in Catholic workhouses, which were found to have extensive state involvement.
abstract: Advocates for survivors of Catholic workhouse system that kept generations of young women and girls in virtual slavery express disappointment and anger at Prime Min Enda Kenny’s failure to formally apologize after report finds extensive state involvement in the institutions; last of such institutions closed in 1996.
lead_paragraph: A 1,o00-page government report puts a spotlight on the detention of thousands of women in Catholic workhouses, which were found to have extensive state involvement.

headline.seo: Irish Premier’s Apology Fails to Appease Workhouse Survivors
headline.main: Irish Premier’s Apology Fails to Appease Workhouse Survivors
headline.print_headline: Irish Premier’s Apology Fails to Appease Workhouse Survivors
